abstract: Jean, an electrician, lives in a tent hidden in the woods outside Paris. Bruno, a manager, lives in a recreational vehicle in the parking lot of a castle. Melissa, who works in a supermarket, and Jimmy, a street sweeper, share a tiny trailer in a campground. They are members of the working poor in Europe, a group whose increasingly dire situation is chronicled by Liz Alderman. She quotes an economics professor who says, "France is a rich country. But the working poor are living in the same condition as in the 19th century."

headline.main: The Ranks of the Working Poor Grow in Europe
